title: How to Make Lip Gloss Using Vaseline and Lipstick

steps.title: Place a spoonful of petroleum jelly into a plastic, zippered bag.
steps.content: Place a spoonful of petroleum jelly into a plastic, zippered bag. You can use any type of petroleum jelly as well. Whatever you end up using, make sure that it is plain and unscented.

steps.title: Cut off a small amount of lipstick, and add it into the bag.
steps.content: Cut off a small amount of lipstick, and add it into the bag. Start out with less lipstick than you think you might need, about ¼-inch (0.64 centimeters). It is always better to start off with too little than with too much; you can always add more lipstick, but you can't take any away. If you want a sparkly lip gloss, use sparkly lipstick. The more lipstick you add, the more opaque your lip gloss will be. Some people find that the moisturizing kind of lipstick is easier to blend than the regular kind. Alternatively, try using eyeshadow to make a lip tint. [1] X Expert Source Nini Efia Yang Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 27 August 2019.

steps.title: Close the bag, then massage the petroleum jelly and lipstick together.
steps.content: Close the bag, then massage the petroleum jelly and lipstick together. Zip the bag shut, then smoosh, squish, and squeeze the petroleum jelly and lipstick together. You can even place the bag on the table, and swirl your finger over it. Keep doing this until the petroleum jelly and lipstick are completely mixed together. [2] X Expert Source Nini Efia Yang Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 27 August 2019. If the lip gloss is not dark enough, add more lipstick. If the lip gloss is too dark, add more petroleum jelly.

steps.title: Snip off the bottom corner of the bag, then squeeze the lip gloss into a small container.
steps.content: Snip off the bottom corner of the bag, then squeeze the lip gloss into a small container. [3] X Research source You can use just about anything for your lip gloss container, including old lip gloss containers. Whatever you decide to use, it must be clean and dry. Choose something that is about 1-inch (2.54 centimeters) wide. [4] X Research source Here are some ideas to get you started: Tiny jars meant for storing beads Tiny jars meant for storing paint Contact lens cases Pill boxes with tight-fitting lids

steps.title: Give the lip gloss a final stir with a toothpick, if needed, then put the lid onto the container.
steps.content: Give the lip gloss a final stir with a toothpick, if needed, then put the lid onto the container. If the lip gloss is not completely blended together, give it a quick stir using a tooth pick. You don't want to see any streaks or swirls. Once you are happy with it, pop the lid onto the container. Your lip gloss is now ready to use! Just keep in mind this lip gloss won't hold very long, so you'll need to touch it up more frequently than regular lipstick. [5] X Expert Source Nini Efia Yang Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 27 August 2019.

steps.title: Put a spoonful of petroleum jelly into a microwave safe bowl.
steps.content: Put a spoonful of petroleum jelly into a microwave safe bowl. Make sure that you are using the unscented kind. The scented kinds often don't taste very good. Remember, you can always add in your own scents and flavors. You do not need to use the petroleum jelly brand. You can use just about any type of petroleum jelly, as long as it is plain and unscented.

steps.title: Microwave the petroleum jelly at 30-second intervals until it is completely melted.
steps.content: Microwave the petroleum jelly at 30-second intervals until it is completely melted. Stir the petroleum jelly between each interval. Depending on the strength of your microwave, it may take up to 1 minute and 30 seconds total. Don't worry if the lip gloss is too gooey and liquid-y. It will become more firm as it cools.

steps.title: Take the bowl out of the microwave, and give it a final stir.
steps.content: Take the bowl out of the microwave, and give it a final stir. This will help the petroleum jelly finish melting as well as smooth out any lumps. Be careful when taking the bowl out of the microwave. It will be very hot. Use a potholder to handle it.

steps.title: Wait for the petroleum jelly to cool off, then stir in a small amount of lipstick.
steps.content: Wait for the petroleum jelly to cool off, then stir in a small amount of lipstick. When the petroleum jelly starts to become solid again, cut off some lipstick, and stir it in. Start out with less than you think you'd need. A little bit of lipstick goes a long way, and you can always stir in more if you need to. If you'd like a shimmery lip gloss, use shimmery lipstick.

steps.title: Consider adding some moisture.
steps.content: Consider adding some moisture. Lip gloss is usually just for looks, but you can make it double-up as lip balm by adding a little bit of nourishing oil to it, such as beeswax, almond or coconut. [6] X Expert Source Shara Strand Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 14 April 2020. Avoid adding too much, however, or your ingredients will start to separate! If you are using almond oil, start with 2 to 3 drops. [7] X Research source If you are using coconut oil, start with ¼ teaspoon of coconut oil per 2 tablespoons of petroleum jelly.

steps.title: Consider adding some flavor and/or sparkle.
steps.content: Consider adding some flavor and/or sparkle. This is not necessary, but it can make your lip gloss taste better. And who doesn't like a little sparkle? Here are some ideas to get you started: 3 to 5 drops of candy flavoring will give the lip gloss a nice, subtle flavor. [8] X Research source A few drops of peppermint extract will give the lip gloss more flavor. You can also use vanilla extract instead. Fruity flavors like cherry are always nice for lips, too. [9] X Expert Source Shara Strand Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 14 April 2020. A sprinkle of cosmetic-grade glitter will give your lip gloss some sparkle. Do not use crafting glitter; even the scrapbooking kind is too thick.

steps.title: Stir everything together one last time.
steps.content: Stir everything together one last time. Stir until everything is mixed together, and there are no streaks or swirls. If you added glitter, be sure to scrape the bottom of the bowl from time to time.

steps.title: Pour the mixture into a small jar.
steps.content: Pour the mixture into a small jar. You can use just about anything that is small for your lip gloss container. Something that is about 1-inch (2.54 centimeters) wide would be ideal. Whatever you choose to use, make sure that it is clean and dry. Here are some ideas to get you started: Tiny jars meant for storing beads Tiny jars meant for storing paint Contact lens cases Pill boxes with tight-fitting lids

steps.title: Place the lip gloss into the fridge, and leave it there until it hardens.
steps.content: Place the lip gloss into the fridge, and leave it there until it hardens. This will take about 20 minutes or so. Leave the cap to the contain off during this time. The lip gloss is ready to use after this. Keep in mind that, unlike lip balm, the lip gloss will always be sort of mushy. It will never harden and become wax-like. Once the lip gloss hardens, you can take it out of the fridge and use it. You don't have to keep it in the fridge any more.
